<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Exhibit&#160;C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. In addition, Tenant&#8217;s Architect (hereinafter defined) will represent Tenant in technical matters that affect the quality, cost or timing with respect to construction and completion of the Premises. All inquiries, requests, instructions, authorizations and other communications with respect to the matters covered by this Exhibit shall be made to Landlord&#8217;s Representative or Tenant&#8217;s Representative and Tenant&#8217;s Architect, as applicable. Either Landlord or Tenant may designate different or additional representatives under this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Exhibit&#160;C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;at any time by giving 10 days&#8217; prior written notice to the other.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Base Building Work
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. Prior to August 31, 2014, Landlord delivered to Tenant the drawings and specifications in AutoCAD format (&#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Landlord&#8217;s Plans
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221;) for (1) the Common Areas, Building shell, public lobbies, elevators, stairwells, (2) on the floors leased by Tenant, core finish, building standard restrooms, primary plumbing, sprinklers, HVAC, mechanical and electrical service, and (3) the parking areas in the parking lots and/or garage, all to the extent reasonably required for Tenant&#8217;s use and occupancy of the Premises. The work required to be accomplished as shown on the Landlord&#8217;s Plans is herein referred to as the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Base Building Work
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221; and the improvements to be constructed pursuant thereto are herein referred to as the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Base Building
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221;. The Base Building Work shall include the work described on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Schedule I
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;attached to this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Exhibit C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Tenant&#8217;s Plans
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	a.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Preliminary Space Plans
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. Not later than September 8, 2014, Staffelbach, the architect engaged by Tenant and approved by Landlord (&#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Tenant&#8217;s Architect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221;) shall prepare and submit to Landlord,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Preliminary Space Plans
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;(herein so called) for the Premises showing: locations of all partitions and doors, annotated to indicate special mechanical/electrical/plumbing requirements; areas requiring ceilings and lighting other than Building standard items; special use areas with requirements such as extra floor loading, or slab penetrations; special HVAC and/or electrical needs; special acoustical separation requirements; and extraordinary City of Dallas building and fire code considerations. Landlord shall review Tenant&#8217;s Preliminary Space Plans and shall notify Tenant in writing within 30 days after receipt thereof of any revisions that Landlord requests, and Landlord&#8217;s reasons therefor.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	b.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Design Development Review
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. Not later than November 1, 2014, Tenant&#8217;s Representative and Tenant&#8217;s Architect will prepare and review with Landlord&#8217;s Representative in-progress design documents prepared by Tenant&#8217;s Architect depicting the then current status of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Design Development
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;(herein so called) for the purpose of informing Landlord of any substantive changes in the Preliminary Space Plans previously reviewed by Landlord. Landlord has the right to approve any substantive changes in the Preliminary Space Plans, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed. This review shall also be used to determine approximate quantities of materials or elements of construction of Tenant&#8217;s Improvements. Landlord shall review Tenant&#8217;s in-progress Design Development documents and shall submit suggested revisions and the reasons therefor to Tenant&#8217;s Architect, in writing, within 20 days after Landlord&#8217;s receipt.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	c.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. Not later than February 2, 2015, Tenant shall submit to Landlord, working drawings and specifications ready for submission to the City of Dallas for a building permit consisting of complete architectural and engineering plans, with HVAC, plumbing, electrical and structural documentation (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8220;Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	) for the proposed construction of all ceilings, lighting, HVAC, plumbing, special use areas requiring modification of the Base Building, partitions, doors, room finish schedules, location of electrical outlets, telephone and data outlets and all other relevant information for the interior finish of, and installation of Tenant&#8217;s improvements in, the Premises (all of the leasehold improvements to be constructed within the Premises pursuant to the Landlord approved Tenant&#8217;s
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	35
</FONT>
</DIV>

<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage145"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	Contract Documents are herein called the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8220;Tenant&#8217;s Improvements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221;). All labor, materials and work required to complete the Tenant&#8217;s Improvements is herein called the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Tenant&#8217;s Work
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221;. Landlord shall review Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents and notify Tenant in writing within 10 days after receipt of Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents of any revisions thereto that Landlord requests, such as, without limitation, a detailed description of any construction delays anticipated to result from matters contained in the Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents, with recommended actions to alleviate those delays. Within 10 days Tenant&#8217;s Architect shall promptly revise Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents to incorporate any agreed changes and shall resubmit them for Landlord&#8217;s approval, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	If Landlord withholds approval of all or any part of Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents, then Landlord shall give Tenant&#8217;s Representative and Tenant&#8217;s Architect a detailed written statement of its objections within 10 days following receipt of Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents. If Tenant disagrees with Landlord&#8217;s objections, then Tenant&#8217;s Representative, Tenant&#8217;s Architect and Landlord&#8217;s Representative shall promptly meet and attempt to resolve Landlord&#8217;s objections. If Landlord does not notify the Tenant in writing of proposed revisions within such 10-day period, Tenant shall deliver a written request for Landlord&#8217;s revisions and if Landlord does not respond to such request within 10 days the Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents will be deemed approved by Landlord.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	4.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Selection of Contractors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. After Design Development review by Landlord, Tenant&#8217;s Architect shall keep Landlord&#8217;s Representative informed of the anticipated date of delivery to Landlord of Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents. If Landlord is retained by Tenant to serve as the construction manager for Tenant&#8217;s Work, then, at least 15 days before the scheduled date of delivery of Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents, Landlord and Tenant shall mutually compile a list of at least three (3) proposed contractors to bid on Tenant&#8217;s Work required by Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents, two (2) of which contractors may be proposed by Tenant. If Landlord is Tenant&#8217;s construction manager, Landlord agrees that it shall competitively bid Tenant&#8217;s Work to all three (3) of the proposed contractors. Tenant may select the contractor with the approval of Landlord, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld, delayed or conditioned. Landlord may exclude from the Building any contractor proposed to perform any part of the Tenant&#8217;s Work, if Landlord reasonably believes that the contractor is incompatible with the Landlord or other contractors and/or subcontractors performing work at the Building. Tenant recognizes that Landlord may require that certain subcontractors be awarded the work for mechanical systems and sprinkler systems to preserve Landlord&#8217;s warranties for those systems installed as part of the Base Building. Tenant agrees that Landlord may award that work to those subcontractors unless their respective bids are unreasonably high when compared to the bids of other bidders for that work. If the subcontractors&#8217; bids for the mechanical systems and/or sprinkler system are unreasonably high, then Landlord may, nevertheless, award the mechanical and sprinkler work to those subcontractors, but Landlord shall bear the portion of the cost for the work performed by those subcontractors which exceeds the reasonable costs and expenses to perform that work. If Landlord is not retained by Tenant to serve as construction manager for Tenant&#8217;s Work, then Tenant may select a qualified contractor to perform the Tenant&#8217;s Work, with the approval of Landlord, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld, delayed or conditioned. The term &#8220;qualified contractor&#8221; shall mean a contractor with a minimum of two (2) years&#8217; experience in constructing leasehold improvements in office buildings and is otherwise creditworthy..
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	5.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Construction of Tenant&#8217;s Improvements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	a.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Construction Contract
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. Upon selection of the contractor(s), as provided above and submission of the Estimated Construction Costs (hereinafter defined), (i) If Landlord is Tenant&#8217;s construction manager, Landlord shall enter into the contract for the construction of Tenant&#8217;s Work; and (ii) Landlord shall promptly proceed with the construction of Tenant&#8217;s Work. If Tenant elects to proceed without retaining Landlord to serve as construction manager, then Tenant shall enter into the contract with the contractor and proceed with construction of the Tenant&#8217;s Work upon Landlord&#8217;s delivery of the Premises Ready for Tenant&#8217;s Work
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	36
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage146"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	(hereinafter defined). The construction contract shall provide, among other things, the following: (1) that the contractor shall construct the Tenant Work in a good and workmanlike manner; (2) that the contractor shall construct the Tenant Work in compliance with all applicable laws, including the ADA/TAS codes, and the Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents; and (3) an express warranty of the Tenant Work from the contractor for a period of one (1) year from completion of the Tenant Work. Landlord&#8217;s Representative shall be responsible for giving the contractor a notice to proceed when contractor may commence the Tenant Work.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	b.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Shop Drawings and Submittals
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. Tenant or Landlord, as the case may be, shall cause the successful contractors to begin preparing shop drawings and processing submittals. If the Tenant&#8217;s Work impacts the Base Building, Tenant&#8217;s Architect shall submit the relevant shop drawings and submittals to the Landlord. Landlord will promptly review them for consistence and integration with the Base Building Work and coordination of other subcontractors&#8217; work and shall forward them to Tenant&#8217;s Architect for review within five (5) business days. Where action and return is requested or required, Tenant&#8217;s Architect will review each shop drawing and submittal and return it with Tenant&#8217;s Architect&#8217;s written comments to Landlord within five (5) Business Days after receipt by Tenant&#8217;s Architect. If Tenant&#8217;s Architect or Landlord does not timely deliver written comments, the requesting party shall deliver a written request for comments and if the other party does not respond to such request within 5 Business Days then such shop drawing and submittal shall be deemed approved by the applicable party.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	c.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Progress Meetings
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. During the construction of Tenant&#8217;s Work, Landlord and Tenant shall schedule &#8220;job progress&#8221; meetings frequently enough to permit regular monitoring of scheduling and status of Tenant&#8217;s Improvements. Landlord&#8217;s Representative shall furnish Tenant&#8217;s Representative and Tenant&#8217;s Architect reasonable prior notice of those meetings and shall require representatives of contractor performing Tenant&#8217;s Work and all major subcontractors having influence on the schedule of Tenant&#8217;s Work to attend together with the Base Building contractor and the subcontractors to the extent affected.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	6.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Inspection and Scheduling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	a.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	Landlord, Tenant and Tenant&#8217;s Architect shall inspect the Tenant&#8217;s Work, as they progress. Each party shall be available, and cause its respective subcontractors and architect to be reasonably available, to the other parties from time to time, on reasonable prior notice, as necessary or desirable to review the Tenant&#8217;s Work.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	b.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	The party entering into the contract with the Contractor shall obtain all approvals, permits and other consents required to commence, perform and complete Tenant&#8217;s Work and shall cause the construction of Tenant&#8217;s Work to comply with all applicable laws, except that Tenant&#8217;s Architect is responsible for Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents being in compliance with the City of Dallas building and fire codes and any other applicable codes and ordinances. The party entering into the contract with the Contractor shall maintain for inspection copies of all approvals, permits, inspection reports and other governmental consents.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:54PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	c.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;If Landlord retained the contractor, then Landlord&#8217;s Representative shall notify, and permit access by, Tenant approximately 30 days before the estimated date the Premises will be Ready for Occupancy so that Tenant may cause cable and wiring and other furniture, fixtures and equipment to be installed to make the Premises ready for Tenant to conduct business.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	7.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Payment of Work Costs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	a.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	The term
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8220;Work Costs&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	, with respect to Tenant&#8217;s Work, means the sum of all hard and soft costs and charges incurred by Landlord or Tenant, as may be the case, for labor and materials in having the Tenant&#8217;s Work performed by the contractor and subcontractors. If any performance or payment bonds are
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	37
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage147"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	required by Landlord, the cost of such bonds shall be at Landlord&#8217;s sole cost and expense and not included in the Work Costs. Any Building stocked materials used by Tenant that are required out of Landlord&#8217;s warehouse shall be charged against the Tenant&#8217;s Work Allowance at the lesser of (i) the cost paid out of pocket by Landlord to the supplier including, if applicable, all stocking costs, taxes, insurance and other soft costs associated with Landlord&#8217;s cost to stock the materials, and (ii) the market cost of such materials. Tenant shall not be required to purchase Building stocked materials; however, if Landlord has previously purchased materials for the Base Building and Tenant desires to use other materials, Tenant shall not be provided a credit for the Base Building materials. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Work Costs include, without limitation all architectural and engineering fees and expenses directly related to Tenant&#8217;s Work, all contractor and construction manager costs and fees, all permits and taxes, and a coordination and administration fee payable to Landlord equal to 2% of the hard costs (the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Construction Supervision Fee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221;) for Landlord&#8217;s overhead if a third party is retained to serve as construction manager instead of Landlord; but shall exclude the costs of any personal property items of Tenant such as decorator items or services, artwork, plants, furniture, equipment or other fixtures not permanently affixed to the Premises. If Landlord provides construction management services for Tenant, Landlord will be paid a fee of not less than 5% of the hard costs included in the total Work Costs, which cost shall be in lieu of the Construction Supervision Fee. If Tenant uses less than the entire Work Allowance for the hard costs and soft costs relating to construction of the Tenant Improvements, Tenant shall be permitted to utilize no more than $4.00 per Rentable Square Foot for furniture, fixtures, equipment, cabling and other costs and expenses relating to the Premises. Landlord shall provide up to an additional construction allowance (&#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Additional Work Allowance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221;) of $15.00 per Rentable Square Foot to be amortized at an interest rate of nine percent (9%) per annum in the form of Additional Rent to be paid over the initial Term of the Lease, should Tenant request such an Additional Work Allowance prior to construction of Tenant&#8217;s Work. Tenant&#8217;s Architect has been engaged to perform preliminary test fits for the Premises and Landlord agrees to provide a space planning allowance (which is in addition to the Work Allowance) equal to $.12 per Rentable Square Foot to defray the cost for such initial test fits which will include all revisions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	b.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	In connection with the construction of Tenant&#8217;s Work, Landlord shall provide an allowance equal to $50.00 per Rentable Square Foot of the Premises that is actually improved(the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8220;Work Allowance&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	) to be applied by Landlord to the Work Costs as set forth below. Tenant shall be responsible for payment of all costs and expenses in connection with the Tenant&#8217;s Improvements in excess of the Work Allowance. Tenant shall not be entitled to a cash allowance under any circumstances. In the event any portion of the Work Allowance is remaining on the date which is 6 months after substantial completion of the Tenant&#8217;s Improvements, such remaining portion shall be the sole property of the Landlord.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	c.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	After selection of the contractor for the construction of the Tenant Work, Tenant will promptly cause to be prepared a preliminary estimate of the cost of the Tenant Work, as described in Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents (the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8220;Estimated Construction Costs&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	). To the extent the Estimated Construction Costs are more than the Work Allowance, Landlord will so notify Tenant in writing and Tenant will establish the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Maximum Approved Costs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221; by either (i) agreeing in writing to pay the amount by which the Estimated Construction Costs exceeds the Work Allowance; or (ii) agreeing to have Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents revised by Tenant&#8217;s Architect within 10 Business Days in order to assure that the Estimated Construction Costs exceed the Work Allowance by an amount that Tenant shall agree to pay pursuant to subparagraph (i) above. Tenant will give immediate attention to establishing the Maximum Approved Costs and respond to Landlord within five (5) Business Days. Upon Tenant&#8217;s timely fulfillment of its obligations in either clause (i) or (ii), the Maximum Approved Costs will be established. Upon establishment of the Maximum Approved Costs, Tenant shall deposit with Landlord the amount by which the Estimated Construction Costs exceeds the Work Allowance (the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8220;Work Costs Deposit&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	), which Work Costs Deposit shall be held in a Landlord controlled checking account designated as an escrow account for the benefit of Tenant in an FDIC insured
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	38
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage148"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	financial institution for payment of the Work Costs. The Work Costs Deposit shall be used only to pay for the Work Costs as the same are incurred, and shall be paid following receipt of properly submitted applications, as Landlord would require for disbursement from the Work Allowance, plus approval by Tenant&#8217;s Representative or Tenant&#8217;s construction manager of the invoice for payment, which approval will not be unreasonably withheld, delayed or conditioned, prior to Landlord&#8217;s payment of any portion of the Work Allowance for such costs. If Landlord is Tenant&#8217;s construction manager, Landlord shall provide Tenant with a copy of all invoices, bills and other similar documentation with respect to each payment made from such account within 10 days after such payment is made. After the entire Work Costs Deposit has been disbursed for payment of the Work Costs, Landlord shall disburse the Work Allowance to pay the remaining Work Costs; provided that in the event the Estimated Construction Costs exceed the Work Costs by an amount in excess of the Work Costs Deposit (the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Excess Costs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221;), Tenant shall promptly pay to Landlord the Excess Costs. In the event the Work Costs Deposit exceeds the Maximum Approved Costs minus the Work Allowance, Tenant shall be entitled to a refund of such excess within 30 days after the Commencement Date. To the extent the Work Costs do not exceed the Work Allowance, Landlord agrees to make payments of the Work Allowance within thirty (30) days following receipt of properly submitted applications, including lien waivers, paid invoices and all supporting documentation of the Tenant&#8217;s Work.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	8.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	In addition to, and separate from, the Work Allowance, and to the extent not already included in any Base Building Work performed by Landlord, Landlord, at its sole cost and expense, (i) shall provide all improvements creating a multi-tenant floor in a manner consistent with comparable office buildings in the uptown market of Dallas, including, without limitation, corridors and restrooms, and (ii) shall provide all &#8220;above the ceiling&#8221; improvements.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Change Orders
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. Regardless of which party holds the contract for construction, Tenant may authorize changes to the Tenant&#8217;s Work during construction only by written instructions to Landlord&#8217;s Representative on a form reasonably approved by Landlord. All changes that involve compliance with laws or Base Building system capabilities will be subject to Landlord&#8217;s prior written approval, which approval shall not be unreasonably delayed or withheld. Prior to commencing any change, Landlord or Tenant will cause the contractor to prepare and deliver to the other party, for the other party&#8217;s approval, a change order setting forth the total costs of such change, which will include associated architectural, engineering, construction contractor&#8217;s costs and fees, completion schedule changes and the costs of Landlord&#8217;s applicable supervision or management fee . The party&#8217;s approval shall not be unreasonably withheld, delayed or conditioned, as applicable. If Tenant is the approving party and fails to approve such change order within 5 days after delivery by Landlord, Tenant will be deemed to have withdrawn the proposed change and Landlord will not proceed to perform such change. Upon Landlord&#8217;s receipt of Tenant&#8217;s approval, Landlord will proceed with such change. The costs associated with a Tenant initiated change order shall be included in Work Costs and shall be payable out of the Work Allowance to the extent available.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	9.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Tenant Delay
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. If Landlord is the construction manager, the term &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Tenant Delay
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221; shall mean any delay that Landlord may encounter in the prosecution of Tenant&#8217;s Work caused by any act, neglect, failure or omission of Tenant, its agents, employees or contractors and shall include, without limitation, any day that occurs: (a)&#160;because of Tenant&#8217;s failure to timely deliver or approve any required documentation such as the Preliminary Space Plans, the Design Development Review or Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents; (b)&#160;because Tenant fails to timely furnish any requested information or deliver or approve any required documents such as the Preliminary Space Plans, the Design Development Review or Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents (whether preliminary, interim revisions or final), pricing estimates, construction bids, and the like; (c)&#160;because of any change by Tenant to the Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents; or (d)&#160;because of any specification by Tenant of long lead materials or installations in addition to or other than Building standard materials; &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	39
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage149"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	10.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Dispute Resolution
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. In the event of a dispute between Landlord and Tenant with respect to any matter relating to this Work Letter, including, without limitation, Tenant&#8217;s Contract Documents, to be resolved by mediation, Tenant&#8217;s Architect and Landlord&#8217;s Representative shall meet to immediately resolve that matter in good faith and as expeditiously as possible. In the event Tenant&#8217;s Architect and Landlord&#8217;s Representative are unable to resolve the matter, then it shall be submitted to an independent architect selected by them, whose decision shall be final. Tenant&#8217;s Architect and Landlord&#8217;s Representative shall select the independent architect by mutual agreement, failing which each shall submit a list of the names of 10 architects in order of preference to the other. The first name appearing on both lists shall be designated as the independent architect. If no name appears on both lists, the process shall be repeated until an independent architect is selected. If a party fails to submit a list, then the first name on the party whose list was submitted shall be the independent architect.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	11.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Punch-List
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. Within ten (10) days after substantial completion of the Tenant&#8217;s Work in the Premises, or applicable portion thereof, Landlord and Tenant shall walk through the Premises together and prepare a punch list of items in the Premises, or portion thereof, that remain to be finished so as to complete the Tenant&#8217;s Work (&#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Punch List Items
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221;). The Punch List Items will not include any damage to the Premises caused by Tenant&#8217;s move-in or early occupancy. Damage caused by Tenant will be repaired or corrected by Landlord or Tenant&#8217;s contractor at Tenant&#8217;s expense. If Tenant fails to submit Punch List Items to Landlord within two (2) months after substantial completion of the Premises, or any portion thereof, it will be deemed that there are no items needing additional work or repair. Landlord&#8217;s or Tenant&#8217;s contractor, as applicable, shall complete all Punch List Items within 30 days after Tenant submits the Punch List Items or as soon as practicable thereafter. For purposes hereof, &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	substantial completion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221; and &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	substantially complete
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221; shall mean when the City of Dallas approves the Premises, or applicable portion thereof for occupancy by issuance of a Certificate of Occupancy.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	12.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Ready for Occupancy Date
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. For purposes of commencement of the Term, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Ready For Occupancy Date
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;is the date that is ten (10) days after substantial completion and the earlier to occur of (i) the date the City of Dallas approves the Premises for occupancy; or (ii) the date the City of Dallas would have approved the Premises for occupancy but for Tenant Delay. In the event Landlord is acting as Tenant&#8217;s construction manager and the Premises are not Ready for Occupancy by September 1, 2015, then Tenant shall receive one (1) day of additional abatement of Base Rent for each day beyond September 1, 2015 until the Premises are delivered to Tenant Ready for Occupancy. The abatement hereunder shall be in addition to any abatement otherwise provided to Tenant as set forth in Section 1.D. If the Premises are not Ready for Occupancy by December 31, 2015 and Landlord is acting as Tenant&#8217;s construction manager, as such date may be extended day by day for each day of a delay caused by a Tenant Delay, then Tenant may terminate this Lease at any time thereafter and prior to delivery of the Premises Ready for Occupancy.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	If Tenant elects to contract with the contractor to perform the Tenant&#8217;s Work, then the Commencement Date will be one hundred twenty (120) days from the date the Premises are delivered to Tenant Ready for Tenant&#8217;s Work, but not earlier than July 1, 2015. The term &#8220;Ready for Tenant&#8217;s Work&#8221; shall mean the Landlord&#8217;s Work is substantially complete. The term &#8220;Landlord&#8217;s Work&#8221; shall mean the Base Building improvements described on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Exhibit C-1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	, attached hereto. &#8220;Substantial completion&#8221; (or words to such effect)for purposes of this paragraph means the Landlord&#8217;s Work is sufficiently complete, including the Building Shell and Service Core with exterior windows in place, building systems brought to the Premises and elevator access completed, as described in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Exhibit C-1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;to the extent necessary for Tenant&#8217;s Work to begin with only minor items remaining in Landlord&#8217;s Work which will not interfere with construction of Tenant&#8217;s Work. Prior to the substantial completion of Landlord&#8217;s Work, Landlord&#8217;s Representative and Tenant&#8217;s Representative shall walk through the Premises for the purpose of establishing that Landlord&#8217;s Work is substantially complete and jointly prepare a list of minor items of Landlord&#8217;s Work which, in the mutual opinion of Landlord and
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	40
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage150"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	Tenant, have not been fully completed or which require repair (the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Landlord&#8217;s Work
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Punch List
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#8221;). If Tenant&#8217;s Representative fails to participate in a walk-through within five (5) days following request by Landlord&#8217;s Representative following substantial completion of Landlord&#8217;s Work, then Tenant shall be deemed to have accepted Landlord&#8217;s Work. If there is a dispute regarding substantial completion or the Landlord&#8217;s Work Punch List, the provisions of Section 10 of this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Exhibit C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;shall apply. Upon written completion of the Landlord&#8217;s Work Punch List, Landlord shall cause its contractor to make the repairs and complete the items on the Landlord&#8217;s Work Punch List in a timely manner and in coordination with the contractor performing Tenant&#8217;s Work to minimize interference with Tenant&#8217;s Work. If any such repairs or completion of Landlord&#8217;s Work will interfere with Tenant&#8217;s Work such that completion of Tenant&#8217;s Work will be delayed or if Landlord fails to obtain any certificates or approvals which, in turn, delay Tenant obtaining receipt of any certificates or approvals from governmental authority, then the 120 day period set forth above shall be extended day for day by any such delay caused by Landlord&#8217;s contractor performing such repairs or completing such other items on Landlord&#8217;s Work Punch List or by Landlord&#8217;s failure to obtain the requisite certificates or permits. &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	13.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Conflicts
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	. In the event of a conflict between the provisions of this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Exhibit&#160;C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;and the provisions of the Lease, the provisions of this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Exhibit&#160;C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;will control.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="EXHIBIT1036_HTM_S9D7467C5AE284DE2B9CB6AEF49391AEA">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	EXHIBIT C-1
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	BASE BUILDING GUIDELINES
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;PADDING-LEFT:144PX;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Landlord shall deliver to Tenant, at no additional expense, all of the items set forth below in accordance with applicable Laws including Building codes and regulations (collectively, &#8220;Code&#8221;), including, without limitation, the ADA, and in good working order. Additionally, Landlord shall construct the Building overall to Class AA standards substantially comparable to other Class AA buildings in the Uptown market of Dallas, Texas and in substantial accordance with Building Schematics (a copy of which has been provided to Tenant).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Building Shell &amp; Service Core
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Building envelope fully finished and in ready condition, including, without limitation, fully waterproofed, caulked, glazed (with all glass requiring replacement due to defects, cracks or broken panes replaced), cleaned (including exterior glass) and with all metal finishing and trim completed, touched up and cleaned;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Building standard window coverings (motorized shades at Penthouse Level 22 only) installed immediately before Tenant&#8217;s occupancy; typical floors will be building standard roll down shades. Shades for the 22
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:7PT">
	nd
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;floor shall be a product of similar look/quality to mecho brand shades and fully motorized, automated and installed at the sole cost of the Landlord immediately before Tenant&#8217;s occupancy
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	c)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;All core walls (not columns) shall be framed with metal studs, dry walled, taped, floated, sanded, and ready to receive final Tenant finishes; exterior walls are all floor to ceiling glass for the exception of two areas where exterior building signage will be installed.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	d)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Concrete floors within Premises shall be broom clean and shall have a Floor Flatness (Ff) of 25 and a Floor Levelness (Fl) of 20.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	e)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;The core area shall be compliant with Code required fire ratings and including the following to the extent located on each floor of the Premises: (i) enclosed, finished and secured mechanical, electrical, telephone/low voltage, toilet and janitorial rooms (collectively, the &#8220;Core Service Rooms&#8221;), (ii) stairways and elevators, and (iii) heating, ventilation, air conditioning (&#8220;HVAC&#8221;), electrical, plumbing and life-safety systems as hereinafter described.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	41
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage151"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	g)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Finished Building standard doors and required hardware compliant with Code at stairwells and core service rooms;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	h)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Core service electrical rooms complete on all proposed floors with transformers and panels. Landlord, at Landlord&#8217;s expense, will provide 5.0 watts (4.0 watts for power and 1.0 watt for lighting) connected load per usable square foot capacity for Tenant&#8217;s use (&#8220;Building Standard Electricity&#8221;). Tenant, at Tenant&#8217;s expense, will also have an additional 2.0 watts (power) connected load available for a total of 7 watts as described below. Such Building Standard Electricity will be metered directly to the Landlord and will be included as part of Operating Expenses;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;In addition, space will be allocated for additional transformers and panels sufficient to provide an additional 2.0 watts (power) connected load per usable square foot capacity for tenant use (the &#8220;Above-Standard Electricity&#8221;) for a total of 7.0 watts connected load. Any distribution equipment (panels, transformers, conduit, wiring, etc.) required to deliver Above-Standard Electricity shall be at the Tenant&#8217;s cost and all consumption on this excess equipment shall be separately metered and billed directly to Tenant by Landlord and shall not be included in Operating Expenses;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	j)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Exit signage as required by Code for the Building Core and Shell. Such signage shall be edge lit acrylic type fixtures;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	k)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;A primary fire/life safety annunciation system as required by Code for the Building Core and Shell and &#8220;backbone&#8221; sufficiently sized for Tenant's secondary distribution as required by Code;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	l)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Core service telephone rooms installed with plywood backboards, interior lighting and electrical outlets, and sufficient sleeves, risers, conduits, and pull-boxes to accommodate the installation of Tenant&#8217;s signal cable from the main point of entry to the site to the Premises, and one 4&#8221; raceway (conduit and/or floor sleeves) from the main telephone room to Tenant&#8217;s floor through the Building&#8217;s secure telecom riser closets which will be available for Tenant&#8217;s exclusive use;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	m)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Men's and women's toilet rooms on Tenant's floors finished to Building standards and compliant with Code, including plumbing fixtures, countertops for sinks, full length and full height mirrors above the vanities, hot and cold (or mixed and tempered) running water, porcelain tile on floors and wet wall surfaces, stainless steel toilet partitions and stall doors, accessories (similar to Bobrick or equal stainless steel), ceilings (painted drywall) and lighting. Tenant at its cost may choose to redesign the bathroom stalls on their floors. Any design alteration to be approved by Landlord. Water closets, urinals, and lavatory faucets shall be hands free operational Landlord will provide the restroom design to Tenant prior to Lease execution and attach an image of the anticipated finishes as an exhibit to the Lease;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	n)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Passenger elevators and freight elevators, including finished interior cabs complete with finished doors, frames, hardware, call lanterns and buttons, fire department connections and egress placards as required by Code and consistent with Building standards. Quantity and speed of elevators shall be designed for a maximum wait time of 30 seconds at peak loading times at full occupancy. Ground floor main lobby elevator entrances shall be stainless steel not less than 9&#8217; tall, stainless steel doors, jambs and returns. Non-main lobby elevator entrances shall include painted elevator doors, jams and returns. Tenant will require that the elevators contain a card access system to limit visitor access; such card access system must be compatible with Landlord's security system and shall be at Tenant's expense.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	o)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Main mechanical system room with equipment, fire dampers and primary medium pressure insulated duct and terminal units. Landlord will provide five (5) VAV box per floor.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	p)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;HVAC: Landlord will provide building standard digitally controlled air handling units, medium pressure duct distribution and fan powered boxes serving five (5) No downstream distribution is provided. Core service rooms will be served with variable air volume boxes and downstream distribution ductwork and diffusers. The base building HVAC system (&#8220;Base Building HVAC System&#8221;) will be designed to provide a minimum capacity of 1 person per 150 USF (&#8220;Building Standard Density&#8221;), and to HVAC and ventilation per ASHRAE 90.1 based on the following criteria:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	(i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Summer design outdoor condition: 98.7&#186;F DB, 75.6&#186;F WB.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	(ii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Summer outside air handling unit design condition: 96&#186;F DB, 78&#186;F WB.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	42
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage152"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	(iii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Winter design temperature: 27.4&#186;F
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	(iv)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Indoor design conditions: 74&#186;F (summer), 72&#186;F (winter) &#8211; maintain plus/minus 2&#186;F.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The indoor air quality shall comply with the ASHRAE standards 62.1 outside air ventilation provided by base building systems on each floor;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	q)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Landlord shall provide supplemental cooling capacity of no less than three (3) tons per Tenant floor for Tenant&#8217;s supplemental cooling systems. Access shall be provided on every other Tenant floor for either chilled or condenser water, including vent and drainage risers, for such systems. Landlord shall make available for Tenant&#8217;s Separate HVAC Equipment for Tenant&#8217;s specific use for above-building standard supplemental air conditioning requirements (i) excess condenser water on a 24/7 basis and (ii) excess chilled water during Building Standard Hours. Tenant&#8217;s use of any chilled water shall be metered at Tenant&#8217;s cost, and Tenant&#8217;s use of condenser water shall be free of charge;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	r)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Areas adjacent to the mechanical rooms capable of maintaining a noise criteria rating of not more than NC-42 and open plan office areas capable of maintaining a noise criteria rating of not more than NC-40. Landlord, at its sole cost shall design and utilize reasonable means to reduce and limit any vibrations, odors, noises, etc. originating from the Building&#8217;s main mechanical equipment on level above or adjacent space, all consistent with comparable first-class office buildings in the Uptown market;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	s)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Primary fire sprinkler system consisting of control and flow valves, primary distribution mains, laterals, and upright sprinkler heads to provide light hazard coverage as required by Code for the Building Core and Shell;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	t)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;When required by the authorities having jurisdiction, fire extinguishers shall be in semi-recessed fire extinguisher cabinets as required for Building Core and Shell;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	u)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Structural floor capacity within the Premises of 80 PSF design live load plus 20 PSF design dead load. Landlord can also accommodate increased floor loading capacities required by Tenant, at Tenant&#8217;s expense, with notice given to Landlord prior to the commencement of Building construction;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	v)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Completed ground floor lobby with finishes to be specified in detail in an exhibit to the lease agreement;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	w)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Completed parking facilities with finishes to be specified in detail in an exhibit to the lease agreement;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	x)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Completed exterior plazas and landscaping with finishes to be specified in detail in an exhibit to the lease agreement;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	y)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Completed loading dock;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	z)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Standard Ceiling Tile: 2x2 tegular edged tiles. The ceiling tile and grid will be similar to Armstrong Dune with SupraFine 9/16&#8221; grid; however, Tenant may elect to receive a credit and upgrade in accordance with paragraph (ff) hereof. The ceiling tile and grid will be stacked on each floor;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	aa)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Standard Ceiling Height of Proposed Tenant Floors: The finished ceilings shall be 10 feet in height or greater for the exception of one area by the restroom walls;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	bb)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;The Building mechanical systems, including electrical systems, ductwork, and sprinkler mains, shall have a clearance of no less than 6&#8221; above Tenant Premises ceiling height; for the exception of one area by the restroom walls..
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	cc)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Standard Lighting: Standard lighting stacked on the floor shall be direct/indirect 2&#8217;x4' with two T8 or latest technology T5/LED lamps, at a ratio of one fixture per 125 RSF;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	dd)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Digital Fan Powered Boxes (FPB) HVAC Boxes: Landlord shall provide five (5) Digital FPB to serve Building perimeter zones;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	43
</FONT>

	ee) &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Building standard doors at stairwells and core service rooms, finished and installed with required hardware and compliant with Code;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	ff) &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Tenant may at their cost may elect to substitute/upgrade materials and to receive a credit in lieu of Landlord providing either (i) the Building-standard ceiling tile specified in item (z) above, (ii), window coverings in item (b) above and/or (iii) the Building-standard lighting specified in (cc) above. Tenant shall notify Landlord in writing of Tenant's election to receive such credit on or before two month before start of TI, and in such event, the credit amount shall be in the amount of the costs paid by Landlord for such items. Any such credit amounts shall be added to the TIA. In the event that Tenant fails to timely notify Landlord of Tenant's election to receive such credit in the manner required above, then Landlord shall provide such applicable items to the Premises;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:96PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:12PT;PADDING-LEFT:48PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	J.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	Wash clean and sanitize all water fountains and coolers, kitchen and coffee bar surface areas, and dining/lounge areas, including but limited to counters, tables, chairs, sinks, and exterior of appliances.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>

	Keep entrance doors to offices locked while cleaning. Upon completion of cleaning, all lights are to be turned off.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	Remove all fingerprints, scuff marks, chewing gum, and other foreign matter.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	Dust all pictures with protective glass surface frames and similar wall hangings not reached in nightly cleaning.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

</FONT>
</DIV>

</TR>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	H.

</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#32;Spot carpet cleaning will be done (as needed) and shampoo carpeted floors at Tenant request at Tenant cost.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

	Janitorial activities should generally be performed at night (i.e., between 6 p.m. and 6 a.m.) or during the weekends unless there is a specific need for work during the day.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	Daily maid services for common area.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
